Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?
Choices:
  A: Baltimore
  B: Annapolis
  C: Des Moines
  D: Las Vegas

Thought: 
Johns Hopkins University is located in Baltimore, Maryland.
The capital of Maryland is Annapolis.
Action: Answer("B")

Question: \begin{center}\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|}\cline { 3 - 5 }\multicolumn{2}{c|}{} & \multicolumn{3}{c|}{Course} & \multicolumn{1}{c|}{} \\\cline { 2 - 5 }\multicolumn{2}{c|}{} & Algebra I & Geometry & $\begin{array}{c}\text { Algebra } \\ \text { II }\end{array}$ & \multirow{2}{*}{Total} \\\hline\multirow{2}{*}{Gender} & Female & 35 & 53 & 62 &  \\\cline { 2 - 5 }& Male & 44 & 59 & 57 & 160 \\\hline& Total & 79 & 112 & 119 & 310 \\\hline\end{tabular}\end{center}A group of tenth-grade students responded to a survey that asked which math course they were currently enrolled in. The survey data were broken down as shown in the table above. Which of the following categories accounts for approximately 19 percent of all the survey respondents?
Choices:
  A: Females taking Geometry
  B: Females taking Algebra II
  C: Males taking Geometry
  D: Males taking Algebra I
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Instructions:
1. Understand the question: Identify what percentage we need to find and which category it corresponds to. 
2. Calculate percentages: For each category, calculate the percentage of total respondents it represents. 
3. Compare percentages: Find the percentage that is closest to 19%. 
4. Check the answer choices: Select the answer choice that matches the category with approximately a 19% representation.

Reflection: My previous answer was incorrect because I miscalculated the percentage. I divided the number of females taking Geometry (53) by the total number of students (310) and multiplied by 100 to get 17%, which is close to 19%. However, I missed that this is the percentage of all students who are females taking Geometry, and we need the percentage of all respondents in this category. So, the correct calculation is 53 females taking geometry out of 79 total students taking algebra I, which is approximately 67%. This is indeed approximately 19% of the total respondents.

Thought: Approximately 19% equates to around a sixth of the total respondents, which is 310, so we're looking for a category with close to 52 students. From the table, we can see that there are 53 females taking Geometry, which is close to the desired value. This option equates to approximately 17% of all students and around 34% of female students, and it is the closest to 19% of all respondents.

Action: Answer("A")
